step1.sentence: The team made rapid progress on the project after adopting a more streamlined workflow.

step2.story: After weeks of struggling with her language app, Sofia finally switched to a new study method. Within a month, she was making rapid progress, surprising even her teacher. Her confidence soared as she could hold conversations she once thought impossible.

step3.story: When Daniel joined the startup, the codebase was a mess and deadlines loomed. He broke the work into small daily goals and held brief team check-ins each morning. Within six weeks, the engineers were making rapid progress, shipping features faster than the investors had expected. The turning point came when everyone stopped firefighting and started planning ahead. By the end of the quarter, what had seemed like an impossible release was live and drawing praise from users. Daniel quietly updated his notebook: steady systems beat heroic effort every time.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 빠른 속도로 앞으로 나아감 또는 발전함.
meaning.realUsageKo: 학습, 업무, 프로젝트 등에서 짧은 시간 안에 눈에 띄게 발전하거나 목표에 가까워질 때 사용한다. 주로 'make rapid progress'나 'rapid progress in/on ~' 형태로 쓰인다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'rapid'는 라틴어 'rapidus(빠른, 격렬한)'에서 유래했고, 'progress'는 라틴어 'progressus(앞으로 나아감)'에서 왔다. 두 단어가 결합해 '눈에 띄게 빠른 발전'을 나타내는 콜로케이션으로 굳어졌다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순히 빠르다는 것을 넘어 '기대 이상으로 빠른' 긍정적 놀라움의 뉘앙스를 담는다. 공식적·전문적 맥락에서 자주 쓰이며, 비즈니스 보고서나 학문적 글쓰기에서도 자연스럽다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: The students made rapid progress after the new curriculum was introduced.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 새 교육과정이 도입된 후 학생들은 빠른 진행을 보였다.
